content: उपनयः {@--1@} Bringing near, fetching. {@--2@} Gaining, attaining, procuring. {@--3@} Employing. {@--4@} Investiture with the sacred thread, initiation into sacred study, handing a youth of the first three castes to a teacher; गृह्योक्तकर्मणा येन समीपं नीयते गुरोः . बालो वेदाय तद्योगात् बालस्योपनयं विदुः ... By this ceremony spiritual birth is conferred upon the youth, and he becomes a द्विजन्मन्; the ages at which the ceremony may be performed by the three castes are respectively 8-16, 11-22 and 12-24; (see <ls>Ms. 2. 36-38</ls>; of what materials &c. the cords should be is mentioned in <ls n="Ms.">2. 41-46</ls>). {@--5@} The fourth member of the five-membered Indian syllogism (in logic), the application to the special case in question; व्याप्तिविशिष्टस्य हेतोः पक्षधर्मताप्रतिपादकं वचनमुपनयः <ls>Tarka K.</ls>
